title:
Colibri5: Real-Time Monocular 5-DoF Trocar Pose Tracking
for Robot-Assisted Vitreoretinal Surgery
description:
We present a real-time marker-less method for 3D pose tracking of trocar, achieved with only a single monocular camera.

Moreover, I contributed as a co-author to the following publications:

  • Uncertainty-Aware Contextual Visualization for Human Supervision of OCT-Guided Autonomous Robotic Subretinal Injection
  • Envibroscope: Real-Time Monitoring and Prediction of Environmental Motion for Enhancing Safety in Robot-Assisted Microsurgery
  • Exploring the Needle Tip Interaction Force with Retinal Tissue Deformation in Vitreoretinal Surgery
organization: CAMP/TUM. Best Medical Robotics Paper Award Finalist.

description: In this project, we utilised Twitter APIs to gather data from Farsi Twitter in order to analyse the trends, influential parties, and groups within the communities. Unfortunately, the project was discontinued due to alterations in Twitter's policies and features.

title: Robotic Navigation Autonomy for Subretinal Injection via Intelligent Real-Time Virtual iOCT Volume Slicing
description: We introduce a framework for autonomous robotic navigation during subretinal injection, utilizing real-time iOCT volume processing. Our method includes instrument pose estimation, online registration, and trajectory planning. We also present intelligent virtual B-scans enabled by CNNs for rapid pose estimation, validated through experiments on ex-vivo porcine eyes. Lastly, we discuss identified challenges and propose solutions for further system development.
organization: Johns Hopkins University (JHU) / Computer Aided Medical Procedures (CAMP/TUM).

title: ColibriDoc: An Eye-in-Hand Autonomous Trocar Docking System
description: We present a platform for autonomous trocar docking that combines computer vision and a robotic setup. Inspired by the Cuban Colibri (hummingbird) aligning its beak to a flower using only vision, we mount a camera onto the end-effector of a robotic system. By estimating the position and pose of the trocar, the robot is able to autonomously align and navigate the instrument towards the Trocar's Entry Point and finally perform the insertion.
organization: CAMP, Klinikum rechts der Isar der TUM, JHU.

title: PointCloud: RECONSTRUCT. SEGMENT. AUGMENT.
description:
Working with an RGB-D camera to reconstruct a scene from a stream, segment the objects inside and change the desired objects with new ones.
Implementation was done in Python, with using open3d library. We also used PointNet++ as our model.
